pto_review: Salary is on par with other similar positions in this area. Quarterly bonuses are nice. Not too demanding of my time.  I work 40 hours and don't travel.  Flexibility of work from home, sometimes, not always.

Extreme amounts of flexibility.  I talk to my manager once every other week and am able to completely make my schedule by myself, meaning I can have 5 home office days where I answer emails in  my pjs, or I can be out in front of 10 different customers every day.  You get to determine how to spend your time base on how you think it will grow your territory.
ml_review: Collaboration. Come as you are diversity. A celebration of science & great benefits. One of the best cultures I've worked at in my career.

pto_review: Work from home/flexible hours, friendly down to earth coworkers,  opportunities to travel worldwide,  wearing multiple hats, fast paced environment.
ml_review: Lot's of liberal-minded policies - LGBQ-friendly weirdo-friendly flexible (but long) schedule.

pto_review: Good pay, benefits, paid holidays, paid vacation.
ml_review: AT&T is a great diverse company to work for with wonderful benefits continued educational encouragement growth opportunities great pay with bonuses and excellent future focused vision. AT&T has a long history of over 100 years of high productivity and fosters creativity innovation and community.

pto_review: Great Culture. Free food. Unlimited PTO  (USE IT). Now they don't have to pay you for vacation time when you leave.
Flexibility, good technologies to work with, opportunities, M&A activity, good benefits, entire week of July 4th & Xmas week is paid time off.
ml_review: Adobe is a truly inspiring place to work. The benefits alone are a show stopper -- above and beyond what any other tech company offers: 6 month paid maternity flexible return to work back from maternity high quality insurance that covers above anything you might want HSA spending for anything not covered reimbursement 1K annually for learning development reimbursement $360 annually for your health & wellness needs -- and so much more.

pto_review: Day 1 benefits, 3 days off, paid/vacation/unpaid time off, voluntary time off sometimes of year (optional), overtime pay during peak.
Great Pay and benefits, and time off.
Pay, Stability, Work load, Culture, Benefits. Of course, alot of these factors really depends on your team/boss - i've been lucky to land in a spot where both are great.

Great culture, everyone pulling in the same direction (no internal politics). Great benefits (>20 days vacation, incredible health plans, sabbatical every four years). Flexible working, forward looking, great people.
Where do I start?  Catered lunches, breakfasts, team game lunches, free health care (family too!),  commuter & wellness fund, over the top parties & holiday events, great pay, work-life balance, etc.
Free snacks, "unlimited" PTO, good benefits, get to work with some great people, a chairman and CEO who actually care about their employees
Remote, Flexible, Friendly Atmosphere, Retirement Benefits even for Part-Time.
Catered lunch once a week, awesome coworkers, free drinks and snacks, 10 hours vacation time accrued per month, extremely reasonably priced benefits.

Good work-life balance. A lot of employees are older, with kids; as a result, the focus is on sustainable work practices rather than a bunch of twenty-somethings competing to see who can work the most hours in a week. Although crunch does occur now and then, the company makes an effort to minimize it. Lots of friendly, intelligent coworkers. Generous time off allowance at Christmas.

Blackbaud provides a great work environment, where new ideas are welcomed, and easy to find people to rally around and support. Bonus and base salary, are highly competitive to comparable careers in larger metropolitan areas. Free beer, wine and food seems to make its way onto the calendar every couple of weeks. Helps reduce work stress as well as build cohesiveness and communication skills between co-workers. 4 weeks paid PTO to start is a nice perk, as well as the ability to roll PTO year over year and gain more PTO through the Volunteer for Vacation program.
Happy Hours, decent pay, good benefits.
Flexible work culture, Challenging work, 401k match, paid time off.
Good benefits. Vacation accrual over ten years equals four weeks.

Benefits and pay are truly excellent. There are generous stipends for transit, wellness, learning and development (books and conferences), and others. Dental, vision, and health are all covered. There is donation matching up to a $1000 per year, unlimited volunteer and paid time off (which, if you're daring enough to request, truly seems unlimited and I have yet to hear of someone's PTO request being declined), and if you're in an office with a Tuck Shop, world-class food served every day. You can gift Dropbox space to friends and family.
ml_review: Great culture friendly people supportive team fun events good compensation. Opportunity for growth and impact. I have never worked for a company that cares so much for their employees.

pto_review: Great place to work with very good compensation, paid time off, bonus and stock options.

Great work life balance, mostly hard working and responsive colleagues that care about their work and the company, 5 free games each year then $20 for additional, company shuttle, EA onsite cafe that generally offers yummy food at pretty fair prices, super nice onsite gym, campus is very nice and chill, bonus/401k match, RSUs.

Days fly by enjoying the challenges of what I am doing. Working with team members is very rewarding. They made me feel right at home during my on boarding and set my expectations correctly for the position I am in. Mentor training was outstanding.

The best company culture. Open, focused, friendly and people first. Here, your voice matters, you get to work on things that matter to you and the company. The company invest in you through many ways (many perks, training materials, PTOs, 4 months parental leave, etc. During calibration you can see how everyone puts people to the top of their consideration.
ml_review: Good salary and bonus structure great fringe benefits - Incredible benefits (health and wellness PTO sick leave parental leave)- Supportive and inclusive work environment w/ focus on representation.

pto_review: Decent benefits - 5 weeks PTO, fully paid maternity leave and paternity leave, lots of company wide events throughout the year, bagels on Friday, some WFH flexibility.

Since the company itself is still fairly young, there were lots of opportunities to move up or move into different positions even within my first few months there. Most employees (at least in Content) genuinely seemed to enjoy working there - plus there was free food, beer on tap, ping-pong, and you could show up to the office in sweats.
Good benefits, good location, laid back dress code, some fun coworkers, good amount of paid time off and sick time.
4 weeks vacation at start, salary, benefits.
Flexible working hours including being able to work from home for a couple of days per week.
Fast pace environment-the days fly by!  We have a great team of employees here, everyone works well together and helps each other out.  Benefits, pay, environment.
ml_review: Lots of opportunities for personal career growth and mentorship.

pto_review: Incredible company to work for, amazing perks, great mentorship. I have been with the company more than 10 years and I feel so blessed of working here.

The employees at HostGator are honestly really great (employees, not leadership). The employees make working at HostGator a fun place to work, and you'll make a lot of friends for outside of work. The medical benefits are good. The health insurance is cheap, and you get a ton of time off. Hourly employees get three weeks off their first year and salaried employees get four weeks. The interview process went smooth, and the recruiter was honest with all of my questions.
Great benefits, Open PTO, No micromanaging, Great work life balance, flexible start/leave times, free lunches 3x a month, Charity days, Lots of growth opportunities, Games room and Company Events.
Good benefits, days off, flexible.
Great benefits, free food, happy hours, unlimited time off.

Great location, great job security , Excellent benefits, Unlimited time off, Great pay + Commission. Been working here a year and I must say I love coming to work because this job is a Godsend. This company shows that there are still organizations that focus on WORK - LIFE Balance.
Great pay, easy to do, nice to set your own hours.
Good work-life Balance. Sabbatical every 4 years.
25 cent sodas, ability to choose your own breaks, good work/life balance, free flu shots, co-workers were awesome, cool office setting.

Many of the startup perks held over as the company matured. Fun culture that generally self selects affable, hard working, people. Unlimited vacation (just make sure you take it because this also means there's no vacation pay out if you leave). Snacks (which could use some rotating but also, you're getting free snacks). Free catered lunch from Whole Foods Monday - Thursday. Beer on tap.
Free lunch, relatively flexible schedule as long as you get your work done. Team meetings to stay in the loop.
Great benefits, great time off.

In my experience there, management really does try to create a positive work environment and listen to all employees. They definitely care about their clients too and worked hard to try and give them the best product they could, even if it meant making big changes. I had a great direct manager that genuinely cared about how I was doing, both in work and on a personal level, and they always asked for my input. Since the company itself is still fairly young, there were lots of opportunities to move up or move into different positions even within my first few months there. Most employees (at least in Content) genuinely seemed to enjoy working there - plus there was free food, beer on tap, ping-pong, and you could show up to the office in sweats.
Casual dress 4 weeks vacation after 2yrs (if you last that long) cheap snacks and sodas, waffle Wednesday, concerts. Nice people, hard workers, overtime allowed.
Work-life balance, offers challenging work, great co-workers made lifetime friends, decent benefits, fun place to work, great place to begin a career.
I worked for them 2 years, Good company, very flexible, they invested  in their people.

No vacation time here at NVIDIA. Instead, you can take what you need given your work load at the moment. Some folks put regular vacations on their calendar (a week every 3 or 4 months) just to make sure they're using their time off.  Some folks abuse the heck out of this system. Many people will tend to check in while on vacation, never really disconnecting from work.
Laid back, easy going and unlimited vacation.
Incredible benefits. Unlimited vacation after 5 years you get a paid subattical.

As any other company, Pivot3 went through many ups and downs plus some growing pains.  But in recent years, things had gotten a lot better, management continue to listen to employees and making correct and positive changes. There are many loyal employees here in Pivot3, all they wanted is getting their voices heard and doing the right thing for the company. They have good work culture, attitude and always willing to help each other out, and now it is being paired with good leaders who listen! Truly believe the future is great for this company.

Great marketing team and still close to coworkers; salary; vacation time; monthly lunches; bar next to desk; open collaborative work spaces; good work/life balance; quarterly bonuses; 75 percent employer-paid health insurance that kicks in immediately.

The Work from Home policy is generous so long as your manager agrees with your doing so.  Benefits are great, vacation time, medical, dental vision, PTO based on tenure, VTO (volunteer time off) 401k - not a 100% match but a cap; no equity as we're private. Work/life balance nonexistent if you live in the easy bay and have to be at HQ.

Procore has all of the typical new age tech company perks: unlimited time off, snacks, beer, bring your dog to work, and free lunch on Wednesday's. The culture is pretty easy going and everyone is pretty relaxed for the most part, depending on the department.
ml_review: CULTURE is a competitive advantage and leadership is serious about giving employees ownership so we can do the best work of our lives.- PAY/BENEFITS are excellent. The opportunities for growth are everywhere as long as you keep your eyes open.

pto_review: After 90 days you get vacation time.
Good benefits, unlimited PTO, some people can work remotely if they like you enough.
Flexable hours. Can work from home when needed. Unlimited vaction' good if decent tech lead.

Great work life balance. Lots of PTO - even though your PTO and sick days come out of the same pool, I currently get 260 hours a year, which is amazing. Pay may be bad for the industry, but is good for the San Antonio area (which has a much lower cost of living than the rest of the country).

WhaleShark really takes care (the word 'pamper' might actually be more appropriate) of its employees.  As former posts have already stated, the perks are countless:  catered food, massages, lavish parties, extravagant giveaways/prizes (i.e., brand new fiat, $20K costco runs), unlimited PTO, transparency, autonomy, getting to work with some of the brightest people in the industry, reimbursed mobile bill/gym membership, downtown location, etc. etc. etc.

Flexible hours, friendly culture, team environment, unlimited vacation, good benefits, accessible executives - couldn't imagine having a better work-life balance. You are treated like an adult and your life outside of work is always taken into account.
ml_review: The company culture is incredible. Everyone wants to help you succeed and you get all the help and resources you need. There is so much room for growth and career development.

pto_review: The goods and services provided by this company will always be in demand. Outstanding employees. Exciting, fast-paced work environment. 401k and other amenities including a gym and personal trainer.
ml_review: Flexible assignments, caring people, career development.

pto_review: Nice place to work, good people and good pay and PTO, paid holidays.
Very chill and laid back environment: no micromanaging, no dress code or requirements, play whatever music you want, themed dress days, understanding managers, flexible time off schedule.
ml_review: Great environment that promotes personal and professional growt.

pto_review: Silabs works hard to keep employees happy: lots of extracurricular activities, lunch and learns, etc. Beautiful offices, lots of high-energy people, a strong sense of community.
Nice office, free drinks and lunch a few times a week.

Great startup with lots of interesting people. It's growing very fast and things are always changing so it is challenging but the environment is very supportive. Amazing benefits including free health insurance, free lunches, happy hours with open tabs, stand up desks, parking downtown, and unlimited paid vacation time.
ml_review: A team that is truly inclusive and where friendships are made. This would not be the case without Chuck who is a fantastic CEO and some of the leaders throughout the company who foster professional growth and development of their teams.

pto_review: People - Willing to help, nice, hard working, welcoming . Flexible Work Schedule - Start & End Times.
Flexible hours, great employee discount, work from home.
Work life balance is amazing. 3 weeks starting vacation, lots of sick days, meetings are usually scheduled to start/end between 10-5.
Work from home. Paid time off. Full Benefits.

Amazing benefits: 401k matching 8%, ton of PTO even starting out and it rolls over to keep accumulating, corporate parties and big events typically paid for year round, work at home opportunities, annual bonus, decent base pay

New CEO has really turned company around, and we're heading in a great direction. As a woman in tech, I feel like my experience at Uber has felt similar to the experiences I've had at other big tech companies. I'm really proud of the products we build, and I'm passionate about our company mission. Employees get an incredible benefits package, and we also receive a couple hundred dollars worth of uber credits to use on either rides or Uber Eats every month (in Seattle, the number is $290, but this is location specific). We also have catered lunch every day, and breakfast is available daily as well (yogurt, bagels, avocados for avo toast, etc), and of course a nice selection of snacks and fancy drinks.
Pay, Work/Life balance and benefits were all great. This company was great to their employees even when working from remote locations.
ml_review: Interesting challenging work with a group of smart people at a company that has great inclusion and community values. I like how the company encourages each of us to make charitable donations by providing various incentives.

pto_review: Flex Fridays we get to work half days for 3 months of the year. Stock plans and bonuses.

I had a great work life balance before they fired my boss along with many others. Then I had a great work life balance because nobody was there to assign projects or care. They had great benefits throughout the years. Bring your dog to work was a great perk, which made at least one day out of the week somewhat ok. At one point the people were great. They have all left, minus a few stragglers. Unlimited Paid Time Off was a nice recent perk, but was only a financial decision, so they didn't have to pay out the week of vacation to all of the people who were quitting. I really believed in the company for a long time, but like Chinese water torture - you can only handle so much before you go insane.
Great benefits, 4 wks paid vacation and sick time, free snacks/drinks, casual dress and atmosphere.

Overall Xerox is a great company to work, lots of benefits, working from home (depending on the manager), Gym, health care, Schedule, no extra hours needed, good work space and good environment amongst employees. Holidays amout to a total of almost 26 days, extra 2 days to benefit people who have never skipped a day's work.

Catered lunch, trips, dog-friendly, happy hour every week or every day depending on how your boss feels, plenty of company outings, work from home, generous vacation and health care benefits. Lots of programs at your fingertips for free.
I have worked  as a full time employee for almost one and a half years, flexible work hours, unlimited PTO, easy work.
